text: Let's talk about Moov, Ableton's new portable tool for fast, intuitive music making.
It's compact and completely standalone, powered by a modern ARM processor.
It has a built-in battery that gives you up to 4 hours of music making on the go per charge.
It even has built-in speakers and a microphone for playback and recording.
You can just pick it up like an instrument and simply create wherever you are in the moment.
Moov features a stereo audio output designed to connect a pair of headphones, a mixer or
powered speakers.
There are also two USB ports, a USB-C port for charging and connecting to the computer
and a USB-A port for connecting MIDI devices.
Moov is built around four flexible MIDI tracks, which could be a drum kit, sampler or instrument.
When you load a new set, the tracks already come pre-loaded with a matching collection
of presets from the sound library, so you can get started right away.
Moov comes with over 1,500 samples, presets and drum kits, including Ableton instruments
and effects such as Drift, Wavetable and Live's new drum sampler, not to mention delays,
choruses and distortions to craft your sound.
The Moov core library has been carefully curated by the Ableton sound team and selected sound
designers that are all pre-mapped to the 8 encoders for instant tweaking of sound parameters
and to give you a punchy, impactful sound at your fingertips.
There's also 64GB of internal storage, so there's plenty of space for your own samples.
Moov comes with Capture that allows you to capture your playing well before you want
to record an idea.
You can even capture the automation of any device parameter you tweak while being in the flow.
The 32 pads on Moov allow you to play your drum patterns and melodies easily.
The pads also feature Aftertouch, which allows you to adjust parameters of an instrument
using pressure.
Whether using the in-key mode or chromatic scale mode for melodies, you can set the key
and scale before you get started with a new project.
You can play any sample melodically using our 16-pitch layout designed for drums in Moov.
This capability transforms Moov into a powerful instrument, allowing you to play individual
samples melodically.
It is especially effective for creating deep bass lines or pitch melodies fast.
The step sequencer is a fun and easy way to use the dedicated 16 steps underneath the
pads to create patterns and melodies.
Add your ideas quickly and specifically into your patterns.
You can even tweak parameters or velocity per step or nudge them slightly off the grid
for a more humanized feel and groove.
Session mode allows you to play with musical ideas we call clips.
Each row of the 8 pads corresponds to all of the clip slots within a single track.
You can manage two effects across an entire set using the 8 encoders.
Moov allows you to directly record sounds into the sampler, offering flexibility in
how you capture audio.
You can record using the built-in microphone for on-the-go sampling or connect external
devices via the line input.
You can even re-sample audio from the main output to create new variations from existing
sounds.
Exporting the set as a WAV or MP3 file is just a few clicks away.
You can export audio using the Moov Manager and you can save your track as a WAV or MP3
file ready to share or edit further.
Moov is designed to be a versatile team player, seamlessly integrating into your audio setup.
Whether you're using it as a standalone device or as a controller for Ableton Live, Moov
adapts easily to your workflow.
You can bring your set into Ableton Live via Ableton Cloud.
Once loaded in Live, you gain access to every single detail of your sound, including your
MIDI sequences and all instrument and effect parameters.
When using Live, you can easily switch Moov into Control Live mode, allowing you to play
and sequence sounds, launch clips and tweak parameters with ease.
Link is a powerful feature that helps you stay in sync with other music tools such as
mobile apps, digital audio workstations or even some hardware devices.
You can connect any class-compliant USB MIDI device to Moov, which opens up a range of
possibilities for your music making.
Additionally, you can control your favorite synthesizer with Moov's incredible pads.
Moov comes with built-in Wi-Fi and a dedicated web interface.
The Moov Manager provides a convenient way for you to organize and manage your content
from a computer or mobile device.
You can download or rename your sets and even upload your own sample collections, enabling
you to customize your Moov experience to suit your creative style.
In standalone mode, Moov supports audio output to your computer.
You can select Moov as the audio input, allowing you to record its main audio directly into
Ableton Live.
And if that's not all, Moov also comes with a free melodics course, offering 50 lessons,
including pad and finger drumming practice designed especially for your Ableton Moov.
